intro: Armeria plantaginea subsp. bupleuroides, commonly known as the bluebell armeria, is a low-growing evergreen perennial native to the western United States. It features dense clusters of small, sky-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its compact growth habit and attractive floral display make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
